DOC.brief_summary: Microcirculation, especially skin microcirculation, is a window towards systemic vascular function in magnitude and underlying mechanisms. Different techniques have been developed to assess the microcirculation. Among these techniques, laser technology is used to perform non-invasive microvascular assessments. Although this technique is widely used, different methodological issues remain. This study aims at defining the way to use lasers for clinical use.
DOC.brief_title: Methodological Issues and Laser Speckle Contrast Imaging
DOC.criteria: age > 18years old subject without any known cardiovascular disease pregnancy
DOC.keyword: laser Doppler flowmetry, skin blood flow
